title: Inflation Fear Lurks, Even as Officials Say Not to Worry
summary: Prices have yet to show much movement, but the prospect of an unbridled economy’s surging back from the pandemic has unsettled the markets.

summary: The German carmaker outlined ambitious goals to build battery factories as it ties its fate to electric cars.

summary: The Federal Reserve crossed red lines to rescue markets in March 2020. Is there enough momentum to fix the weaknesses the episode exposed?

summary: Retail investors see the tiny companies as the next big opportunity after meme stocks and cryptocurrency. But shares are an easy target for fraud.

summary: But the giant oil company said it would pay $75 billion in dividends, nearly all of it to the Saudi government.

summary: Analysts say the problem is unlikely to alter more important concerns facing the industry, including worries that an economic recovery may be slower than expected.

summary: The shutdown of the vital waterway and its impact on trade underscore the world’s reliance on global supply chains.

summary: The most common option for ships trying to avoid the logjam is to reroute themselves around Africa’s Cape of Good Hope.

summary: The president began selling his proposal on Wednesday, saying it would fix 20,000 miles of roads and 10,000 bridges, while also addressing climate change and racial inequities and raising corporate taxes.

summary: The president is hoping to make electric vehicles more affordable to turn a niche product into one with mass appeal.

summary: Some members wanted to take advantage of what they saw as a growing global thirst for oil as economies slowly expand after pandemic lockdowns.

summary: Gains were largely driven by technology shares, and the record close was the latest in a series of new highs for the S&P 500.

summary: Analysts said Saudi Arabia’s oil minister appeared to be calculating that by appeasing other oil producers, he can remain in control over the longer term.

summary: Job growth rose to its highest level since last summer, buoyed by vaccines and federal aid.

summary: Under pressure to renounce cotton harvested in a Chinese region marked by gruesome repression, they face a backlash from nationalist Chinese consumers.

summary: The proposal includes provisions to raise the corporate tax rate to 28 percent, make it harder for companies to move profits overseas and beef up the Internal Revenue Service.

summary: Demand for oil and gas is rising, yet it is expected to decline in the future as the world responds to global warming. Where does that leave investors?

summary: Many victims of Stalin’s gulag are still unable to return to their families’ hometowns. Despite a court order, Moscow isn’t helping them.

summary: The announcement came at a time when the Biden administration has been quietly pressing Mexico to ramp up its efforts to limit the flow of migrants.

title: Myanmar Protesters Answer Military’s Bullets With an Economic Shutdown

summary: While Washington went into business with the drug companies, Europe was more fiscally conservative and trusted the free market.

summary: The country’s currency has sunk to a new low against the dollar, sending prices for once affordable foods soaring out of reach.

summary: Tugboats and dredgers were toiling to release the wedged container vessel, which is obstructing the crucial artery of global trade like “a very heavy beached whale,” one expert said.

summary: In rejecting a request from some provinces to strike down national carbon pricing, the court declared that the measure meets an important national need.

summary: It took 10 years and 1.5 million workers to build the waterway in the 19th century, and one day and one giant ship to clog it in 2021. The vessel has been refloated, but the disruption could linger.

summary: Israel and Iran have fought a clandestine war across the Middle East for years, mainly by land and air. Now ships are under attack in the Mediterranean and Red Seas.

title: Iran Nuclear Talks Start on Positive Note in Vienna
summary: Working groups on sanctions and uranium enrichment are making progress, diplomats said. The indirect negotiations between Tehran and Washington are set to resume next week.

title: A Bleak Forecast for Canada’s 600,000 Energy Industry Workers
summary: A report forecasts that up to three quarters of their jobs may vanish in a low carbon future and suggests a better approach to retraining.
